item.title: OK, what’s going on with LinkedIn’s algo?
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: Women ran an experiment to see if LinkedIn's new algo was being sexist and thought they proved it. But there's more complexity involved, experts say.

item.title: Trump’s AI executive order promises ‘one rulebook’ — startups may get legal limbo instead
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: Trump signed an AI executive order targeting state laws and promising one national rulebook. Critics warn it could trigger court battles and prolong uncertainty for startups while Congress debates federal rules.

item.title: Google Translate now lets you hear real-time translations in your headphones
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: The real-time headphone translations experience keeps each speaker’s tone, emphasis, and cadence intact, so it’s easier to follow the conversation and tell who’s saying what.

item.title: ChatGPT: Everything you need to know about the AI-powered chatbot
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers, Cody Corrall, Kate Park, Alyssa Stringer
item.description: A timeline of ChatGPT product updates and releases, starting with the latest, which we’ve been updating throughout the year.

item.title: Google launched its deepest AI research agent yet — on the same day OpenAI dropped GPT-5.2
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: For the first time, developers can embed Google's Deep Research tool, based on Gemini 3 Pro, into their own apps.

item.title: 1X struck a deal to send its ‘home’ humanoids to factories and warehouses
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: Despite launching as a humanoid robot designed to help consumers around the house, 1X's Neo robots are heading to industrial use cases.

item.title: Disney hits Google with cease-and-desist claiming ‘massive’ copyright infringement
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: Disney is accusing the tech giant of unauthorized distribution of its copyrighted characters without permission via Gemini AI.

item.title: Google’s AI try-on feature for clothes now works with just a selfie
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: In the past, users had to upload a full-body picture of themselves to virtually try on a piece of clothing. Now they can use a selfie and Nano Banana will generate a full-body digital version of them.

item.title: OpenAI fires back at Google with GPT-5.2 after ‘code red’ memo
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: OpenAI just launched GPT-5.2, a frontier model aimed at developers and professionals, pushing reasoning and coding benchmarks as it races Google’s Gemini 3 while grappling with compute costs and no generator.

item.title: Google debuts ‘Disco,’ a Gemini-powered tool for making web apps from browser tabs
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Google Labs is testing a product that will work with your browser tabs to make web apps for you.

item.title: Runway releases its first world model, adds native audio to latest video model
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta, Rebecca Bellan
item.description: Runway debuts a physics-aware world model that simulates reality to train agents and power video, robotics, and avatar applications.

item.title: Disney signs deal with OpenAI to allow Sora to generate AI videos featuring its characters
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: Disney says that alongside the agreement, it will "become a major customer of OpenAI," as it will use its APIs to build new products, tools, and experiences, including for Disney+.

item.title: TIME names ‘Architects of AI’ its Person of the Year
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: TIME Magazine has named the 'Architects of AI' its Person of the Year, who include Jensen Huang, Elon Musk, Sam Altman, Mark Zuckerberg, Lisa Su, Dario Amodei, Demis Hassabis, and Fei-Fei Li

item.title: Opera wants you to pay $20 a month to use its AI-powered browser Neon
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Following a couple of months' testing, Opera has finally made its AI-powered browser, Neon, available to the public — though you'll have to shell out for a $19.90-per-month subscription to use it.

item.title: Interest in Spoor’s bird-monitoring AI software is soaring
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: Spoor's computer vision software can help wind farms, and other industries, track bird populations and migration patterns.

item.title: Port raises $100M at $800M valuation to take on Spotify’s Backstage
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: Port offers a proprietary alternative to Spotify's popular devtool catalog Backstage, but with a valuable addition — it can be used to manage AI agents, too.

item.title: Harness hits $5.5B valuation with $240M raise to automate AI’s ‘after-code’ gap
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: Goldman Sachs has led Harness's Series E round, with participation from IVP, Menlo Ventures, and Unusual Ventures.

item.title: Baby delivered in Waymo continues proud tradition of not making it to the hospital
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: A pregnant woman in San Francisco gave birth inside a Waymo robotaxi Monday night en route to UCSF Medical Center, marking the latest milestone in the driverless car saga that no one saw coming -- except everyone with more than six months of experience behind the wheel of a ride-share vehicle.

item.title: Google’s answer to the AI arms race — promote the guy behind its data center tech
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: Amin Vahdat has been promoted to chief technologist for AI infrastructure, a newly created position reporting directly to CEO Sundar Pichai.

item.title: State attorneys general warn Microsoft, OpenAI, Google, and other AI giants to fix ‘delusional’ outputs
item.dc:creator: Lucas Ropek
item.description: The letter demanded companies institute new safeguards to keep users safe from harmful psychological impacts.
